column1: #Text=by means similar to those employed in the preparation of the Nitric Acid.
#Text=In this state heavier than Atmospherical Air ;
#Text=100 cubic inches at mean pressure and temperture, weighing 39 grains ; of a pungent odour ;
#Text=it under extinction a bright green colour; inflames the skin without discolouring or corroding it
#Text=Formerly supposed to consist of an unknown
#Text=researches of Professor Davy, by which this
#Text=When dry has no action on the Metals, nor
#Text=on any other of the Combustible Substances.
#Text=Exposed to a moist atmosphere it becomes
#Text=cloudy —Is readily absorbed both by Water and
#Text=Ice, the latter of which it liquefies: in either
#Text=case it occasions an increase of Temperature and
#Text=water the general properties of an Acid (Acidam
